intro: Erigeron minor, commonly known as lesser fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron minor is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
